text: <!channel>: We are officially cleared for a tour of Ziba’s offices with their operations manager, Ken. Ken has been with them since the beginning and had a big role in getting their current studio designed and built. He agreed to take us through on a hosted tour, with a chance to learn about their process, what worked, and what they’d change. I’ll work with <@U02918BKW> to get details worked out, but I’d love to have as many of us as possible along for the visit.
Given our group’s size, we’ll have to aim for after-hours starting at 5pm so we’re not a disruption. Good thing is that we’ll probably have more access to the spaces without other people there.
Oh I really like ken!
awesome! thanks for putting this together
any possibility to do it before 10/1 so people can use it as part of a commute?
hehe
I would like to go, but don’t have much after-work time available over the next week
^^ same
invite is pretty open-ended, so we can shoot for a time when we can get nearly everyone over there
well being a bit greedy here, and business focused - this pertains to some arya decision making so i probably will be inclined to make it happen when it works for me.
so apologies in advance if that creates exclusion - willing to bet they'd host a second one.
no es justo!
No señor Juan.

attachments.fallback:
*Notes from the Arya Bike Storage Sub-Committee:*

if against a wall, consider the material of the wall and the fact that it will get beat up
could be free-hanging - hooks from ceiling
consider flooring between elevator and bike area and the fact that it should not be too slippery / precious

NEED
should be close to the elevator
need to be able to bring our bikes on the elevator
vertical
staggered, like the ones downstairs - those heights are good
~15 bikes

WANT
coat hooks
something like this in the ground-floor bike area would be awesome:
<http://www.baltimorefishbowl.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/Johns-Hopkins-Bike-Repair-Stand-500x375.jpg>
power outlets
